result.execSummary:
The defendant Martin Bottomley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
DNA sample
Counseling as required

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Martin Bottomley

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Balance Inquiry from DOC - amounts verified  (DOC assessments modified to zero)
Request received from DOC to enter civil judment however payment received, no civil judgment entered

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Martin Bottomley in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 9:01 a.m. State has complied with VWNR. Agreement stated - Def will plead to charge.  Withheld sentence, 1 yr probation, counseling, court costs. Def agrees. Court reviews atty rights. Court finds Def freely & voluntarily waives atty and is competent to represent himself on this charge. Plea quest. filed. No contest plea. Constitutional rights, elements, possible penalties reviewed. Court finds Def understands and plea freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts plea and finds guilty of disorderly conduct. Sentencing remarks by the State. Statement by Defendant. Remarks by the Court. Court will follow agreement. Sentence withheld, 1 yr probation, counseling as required, credit for 1 day if revoked, court costs, DNA sample and surcharge.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Postconviction rights.

Defendant Martin Bottomley in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Called at 2:06 pm  Court reviews file.  Def has copy of complaint.  Court reviews charge with possible penalties.  Def advised of right to an atty.  DA provides an offer to def.  Def will agree to offer.  Court instruct clerk to enter not guilty plea.  Bond will continue with conditions  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 25, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Martin Bottomley in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 10:33 am.  Def. explains why missed court. Vacate warrant.  State will reinstated signature bond.  Court will reinstate $500 signature bond with same conditions. Def. advised of atty rights. No new bond needed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Martin Bottomley not in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Called at 2:42 pm  Def signed a signature bond for todays date.  State request warrant, $1000. bond, state wide.  Court so orders warrant, bond $1000. or body.
